alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 7:53PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Kansas, including the following county, Sumner. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is likely. Low-water crossings may not be passable. Street flooding is likely in and around towns. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low- lying and flood-prone locations is likely. Low-water crossings may not be passable. Street flooding is likely in and around towns. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area through midnight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Wellington, Mulvane, Belle Plaine, Conway Springs, Oxford, Argonia, Mayfield, Milan, Wellington Airport, Riverdale and Perth.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
